com.msd.queryengine

Class PaperQueryBuilder

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.msd.queryengine.PaperQueryBuilder

  • public class PaperQueryBuilder
extends java.lang.Object
    The Class PaperQueryBuilder builts the required join conditions used to built the required query to fetch authors matching the user given search parameters.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.String> fromParams
      Maintains the list of from table params used to build the final query.
      (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.String> joinParams
      Maintains the list of tables used in the join condition to build the final query
      (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.String> onParams
      The Maintains the list of on conditions used for joining different tables maintained in JoinParams
      (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.String> userInputs
      Maintains the list of userinputs which is later used to prepare dynamic preparedstatement
      (package private) java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> userInputType
      Maintain type of each userInput 1 means string 0 means integer.

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void createPaperQuery(java.lang.String publicationType, java.lang.String PaperTable, java.lang.String AuthorTable, SearchParameters searchParams)
      Creates the relevant join and on params expected in the final query from to get details specific to paper like conference paper information and journal paper information with filters for the user entered search parameters.
      void setParams(java.util.List<java.lang.String> joinParams, java.util.List<java.lang.String> onParams, java.util.List<java.lang.String> fromParams, java.util.List<java.lang.String> userInputs, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> userInputType)
      Used to set the userinput details and the currently accumulated onParams,fromParams,joinParams built by other components of the QueryBuilder Allocation for the same is in QueryBuilder.

    • Method Detail

      • setParams

        public void setParams(java.util.List<java.lang.String> joinParams,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> onParams,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> fromParams,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.String> userInputs,
                      java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> userInputType)
        Used to set the userinput details and the currently accumulated onParams,fromParams,joinParams built by other components of the QueryBuilder Allocation for the same is in QueryBuilder. So the currently accumulated contents of these are received into this class.
        Parameters:
        joinParams - Maintains the list of tables used in the join condition to build the final query
        onParams - The Maintains the list of on conditions used for joining different tables maintained in JoinParams
        fromParams - Maintains the list of from table params used to build the final query.
        userInputs - The current list of user input data
        userInputType - The current list of user input data type

      • createPaperQuery

        public void createPaperQuery(java.lang.String publicationType,
                             java.lang.String PaperTable,
                             java.lang.String AuthorTable,
                             SearchParameters searchParams)
        Creates the relevant join and on params expected in the final query from to get details specific to paper like conference paper information and journal paper information with filters for the user entered search parameters.
        Parameters:
        publicationType - the publication type which is either conference or journal
        PaperTable - the paper table name which is either conferencepaper or journalpaper
        AuthorTable - the author table which can be either conferenceauthor or journalauthor
        searchParams - the search params entered by the user for which query is to be built
